t: Psalm 7
In You Do I Take Refuge
A Shiggaion of David, which he sang to the Lord concerning the words of Cush, a Benjaminite.
O*pn Lord*s my God, in you do I take refuge; save*ld me from all my pursuers and deliver me,
lest*ln like a lion they tear my soul apart, rending*ld it in pieces, with none to deliver.
O*pn Lord*s my God, if I have done this, if*ld there is wrong in my hands,
if*ln I have repaid my friend with evil or*ld plundered my enemy without cause,
let*ln the enemy pursue my soul and overtake it, and*ld let him trample my life to the ground and*ld lay my glory in the dust. Selah*ig
Arise,*pn O Lord,*s in your anger; lift*ld yourself up against the fury of my enemies; awake*ld for me; you have appointed a judgment.
Let*ln the assembly of the peoples be gathered about you; over*ld it return on high.
The*pn Lord*s judges the peoples; judge*ld me, O Lord,*s according to my righteousness and*ld according to the integrity that is in me.
Oh,*ln let the evil of the wicked come to an end, and*ld may you establish the righteousâ€” you*ln who test the minds and hearts, O*ld righteous God!
My*ln shield is with God, who*ld saves the upright in heart.
God*ln is a righteous judge, and*ld a God who feels indignation every day.
If*pn a man does not repent, God will whet his sword; he*ld has bent and readied his bow;
he*ln has prepared for him his deadly weapons, making*ld his arrows fiery shafts.
Behold,*ln the wicked man conceives evil and*ld is pregnant with mischief and*ld gives birth to lies.
He*ln makes a pit, digging it out, and*ld falls into the hole that he has made.
His*ln mischief returns upon his own head, and*ld on his own skull his violence descends.
I*pn will give to the Lord*s the thanks due to his righteousness, and*ld I will sing praise to the name of the Lord,*s the Most High.
